Author: No-Group-4504

Comment: Why should it? This trade war was over before it began. China will not bow to pressure from the US or internally. Exports to the USA comprise only 3% GDP . It is now using this debacle as an opportunity to open up new markets and displace the US.   It has already cancelled beef and LNG contracts. Cancellations will continue and this business will flow to nations with weaker currencies and closer proximity. China's imports will become cheaper and this business will never return to the US.  Trump is weakening the USA to the point of economic recession, or worse. With a weakening USD and retreating bond market it is in deep trouble.  China has the US by the balls and can choose to dump its considerable bond holdings. This and its ability to inflict a rare earth shock hangs like the sword of Damocles over Trump's head.

Comment: Yes. And it's completely alienating America from people who used to feel like they were the USA's allies (but thanks to Trump, don't anymore).    The rest of the world's mission to foster an economy that navigates America has never been so pressing. The prestige of the American dollar as a global currency was built on the nations dependability. But America is no longer a dependable partner (with a "friend" like this, who needs enemies?).   I'm from the UK and 1000s of our troops died fighting in Americas wars in Iraq & Afghanistan. And what for? It's not only that those wars were absolute disasters, but we can't even say we made those sacrifices for a worthwhile ally.    Why should we ever come to America's aid ever again?  The attitude now will rapidly become "If you want to set countries on fire, then you can fight those fires alone.".

Author: Creative_Recover

Comment: You have clearly never visited China or had meaningful conversations with Chinese people. Yes the government does control many aspects of Chinese lives, but they are not conditioned to being uncomfortable. The standard of living and quality of life has improved drastically over the last several decades. The government has invested heavily in infrastructure, education, economic development, and jobs while the US has been bogged down in culture wars and bipartisan hostility. VPN’s are common in China and the citizens have access to the same information as the rest of the world. They are far from perfect, but most Chinese citizens see the government as improving their lives and putting them on a par with the US.  They aren’t going to accept being dictated to.

Author: FrazzleMind

Comment: I agree with most of what you said there. What I don't agree with is the level of tolerance the Chinese have for their government v. the American level. I didn't say they don't have a positive view of their government. My Chinese friend does. I said they will tolerate a lot more from their government than we will ours. Their country is run by communists... They know there is very little they can do to change policy once the government makes a decision. It's getting bad in the US, but the public can still effectively pressure congress.  I don't think they mind the fight... I'm sure their attitude is a lot like the Canadians. We basically, unprovokedly, attacked them with a trade war. I think the reaction to want to fight back is human nature... They have a reason to want to fight, and we don't. We have half a country that went into the fight wondering why the fuck we're doing this, with more than half against it.   They're not going to be protesting their government the way we are going to when those prices skyrocket. They probably won't protest at all. What's there to protest. They were attacked with a trade war, and they're responding.
